intro: Helianthostylis guggenheimii, commonly known as the Guggenheim's helianthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a relatively small shrub, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
